imageRequirements.title: Container Isolated Environment
imageRequirements.description: Diagram illustrating a single Docker container as a lightweight, isolated execution environment. Show the container box with its own application, libraries, and dependencies, running on a shared host OS kernel. Highlight the clear boundary separating it from other containers and the host.

imageRequirements.title: VMs vs. Containers Architecture
imageRequirements.description: Side-by-side comparison diagram. On one side, 'Virtual Machine' stack: Hardware -> Host OS -> Hypervisor -> Multiple Guest OSes (each with apps, libs, its own kernel). On the other, 'Docker Container' stack: Hardware -> Host OS (single kernel) -> Docker Engine -> Multiple Containers (each with apps, libs, sharing host kernel). Emphasize the lightweight nature and shared kernel for containers.

imageRequirements.title: Managing Many Containers Manually
imageRequirements.description: Diagram showing multiple isolated Docker containers scattered across one or more hosts, each represented by a small box. Use tangled lines or question marks to visually represent the complexity and difficulty of coordinating, updating, scaling, and networking these containers without an orchestration tool. Suggest a feeling of unmanageability.

imageRequirements.title: Kubernetes Basic Architecture
imageRequirements.description: Simplified architecture diagram of a Kubernetes cluster. Show a 'Control Plane' (master node) with components like API Server, Scheduler, Controller Manager, etcd. Show multiple 'Worker Nodes' (minions) each with Kubelet, Kube-proxy, and Container Runtime (e.g., Docker). Illustrate pods/containers running on worker nodes, managed by the control plane. Use arrows to show the management flow.

imageRequirements.title: Kubernetes Container Orchestration
imageRequirements.description: Workflow diagram illustrating how Kubernetes orchestrates containerized applications. Start with a developer deploying an application (represented by a YAML manifest). Show the Kubernetes Control Plane (API Server, Scheduler) processing this request and distributing 'Pods' (containing containers) across available 'Worker Nodes'. Highlight features like self-healing, scaling, and load balancing of these pods/containers. Use clear arrows to depict the management and deployment flow.
